R23.shortName: Type of Activities Other Current Liabilities (Details)

R24.shortName: Type of Activities Other Deferred Inflows (Details)

R25.shortName: Type of Activities Other Restricted Components of Net Position (Details)

R27.longName: 501800 - Proprietary Funds Net Position - Business Activities Other Current Liabilities (Details)

R9.shortName: Capital Assets Not Being Depreciated Component Unit (Details)

role.documentation: Accounts payable is a liability account reflecting amounts owed to private persons or organizations for goods and services received by a government.
role.label: Accounts Payable

role.documentation: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of liabilities incurred (and for which invoices have typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received that are used in an entity's operations and due within one year.
role.label: Accounts Payable and Accrued Expenses

role.documentation: Accounts receivable.
role.label: Accounts Receivable

role.documentation: Payments received for revenues not yet earned in the current fiscal year.
role.label: Total Accrued Expenses and Unearned Revenues

role.documentation: Accrued expenses payable.
role.label: Accrued Expenses Payable

role.documentation: Accrued health care liability.
role.label: Accrued Health Care Liability

role.documentation: Accrued interest payable.
role.label: Accrued Interest Payable

role.documentation: Accrued tuition and fees.
role.label: Accrued Tuition and Fees

role.documentation: Accrued wages and related liabilities payable.
role.label: Accrued Wages and Related Liabilities Payable

role.documentation: The accumulation of amortization.
role.label: Accumulated Amortization

role.documentation: The accumulation of systematic and rational allocations of the estimated cost of using assets, on a historical basis, over the useful life of the assets.
role.label: Accumulated Depreciation

role.documentation: The total amount of depreciation expense that has been recorded from the time the asset was put into service until the date of the balance sheet.
role.label: Accumulated Depreciation and Amortization

role.documentation: Information about Net Position on the Statement of Activities.
role.label: Activities Changes in Net Position [Abstract]

role.documentation: Information about revenue designated for specific programs on the Statement of Activities.
role.label: Statement of Activities, Expenses and Revenues for Programs and Functions [Abstract]

role.documentation: Used to collect information about revenue designated for specific programs.
role.label: Statement of Activities, Expenses and Revenues for Programs and Functions [Line Items]

role.documentation: Information about expenses for programs and functions on the Statement of Activities.
role.label: Activities Expenses For Programs and Functions [Abstract]

role.documentation: Information about General Revenues on the Statement of Activities.
role.label: Activities General Revenues [Abstract]

role.documentation: Used to collect information about revenue sourced from specific programs.
role.label: Statement of Activities, General Revenues and Changes in Net Position [Line Items]

role.documentation: Information about revenues for programs and functions on the Statement of Activities.
role.label: Activities Revenues for Programs and Functions [Abstract]

role.documentation: Adjustments for transfer of revenues within activities which includes a) significant transactions or other events within the control of management that are either unusual in nature or infrequent in occurrence are special items. Special items should also be reported separately in the statement of activities, before extraordinary items, if any. In addition, governments should disclose in the notes to financial statements any significant transactions or other events that are either unusual or infrequent but not within the control of management, b) extraordinary items that are transactions or other events that are both unusual in nature and infrequent in occurrence. Extraordinary items should be reported separately at the bottom of the statement of activities, c) contribution to permanent fund are amounts remitted to funds whose principal balances may not be legally expended.
role.label: Adjustments for Transfer of Revenues Within Activities

role.documentation: Adjustments in fund balances to account for decrease (increase) in assets.
role.label: Adjustments in Fund Balances for Decrease (Increase) in Assets

role.documentation: Adjustments in fund balances to account for increase (decrease) in liabilities.
role.label: Adjustments in Fund Balances for Increase (Decrease) in Liabilities

role.documentation: Adjustments in fund balances for restatements (errors and accounting policy), includes prior period adjustments to fund balances. Items that are reported as prior-period adjustments should, in single-period statements, be reflected as adjustments of the opening balance of net position. When comparative statements are presented, corresponding adjustments should be made of the amounts reported in the flows statement and the statement of net position for all of the periods reported therein to reflect the retroactive application of the prior-period adjustments. (See paragraph .125 for required disclosures of prior-period Adjustments.) [GASBS 62 and 61, as amended by GASBS 63 and 8].
role.label: Adjustments in Fund Balances for Restatements (Errors and Accounting Policy)

role.documentation: Adjustments in net position for restatements (errors and accounting policy). Amounts are reflected as adjustments to the opening balance of the net position.
role.label: Adjustments in Net Position for Restatements (Errors and Accounting Policy)

role.documentation: Advances from grantors.
role.label: Advances from Grantors

role.documentation: Advances from other funds that the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.
role.label: Advances from Other Funds

role.documentation: Advances to other funds that the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.
role.label: Advances to Other Funds

role.documentation: Asset valuation allowances for losses, such as those on tenant receivables, should be deducted from the assets or groups of assets to which the allowances relate, with appropriate disclosure.
role.label: Allowance for Doubtful Accounts

role.documentation: The amount of amortization expense recognized in the current period.
role.label: Amortization Expense

role.documentation: Amount held for others that the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.
role.label: Amount Held for Others

role.documentation: Special assessments due within one year but not yet collected as of the balance sheet date.
role.label: Assessments Receivable

role.documentation: Resources with present service capacity that the government presently controls.
role.label: Assets

role.documentation: Information about assets.
role.label: Assets [Abstract]

role.documentation: Summation of assets and deferred outflows of resources.
role.label: Assets and Deferred Outflows of Resources

role.documentation: Held for resale assets are long -lived assets that have been previously bought, for which there is a concrete plan to dispose of the asset by sale.
role.label: Assets Held for Resale

role.documentation: Expenses for bad debt.
role.label: Bad Debt Expense

role.documentation: Bond and interest payable, matured.
role.label: Bond and Interest Payable, Matured

role.documentation: The unpaid portion of interest due to the issuance of bonds.
role.label: Bond Interest Payable

role.documentation: The balance of bonds payable not due within one year.
role.label: Bond Payable, Noncurrent

role.documentation: Amount of bonds and interest payable.
role.label: Bonds and Interest Payable

role.documentation: Amount of bonds and interest payable, classified as current.
role.label: Bonds and Interest Payable, Current

role.documentation: Amount of bonds and interest payable, classified as noncurrent.
role.label: Bonds and Interest Payable, Noncurrent

role.documentation: The balance of bonds payable due within one year.
role.label: Bonds Payable, Current

role.documentation: Amount before accumulated depreciation of building structures held for productive use including addition, improvement, or renovation to the structure, including, but not limited to, interior masonry, interior flooring, electrical, and plumbing.
role.label: Buildings

role.documentation: Represents business-type activities, which is one of two classes of activities reported in government-wide financial statements. Business-type activities are financed in whole or in part by fees charged to external parties for goods or services. These activities usually are reported in enterprise funds.
role.label: Business Type Activities [Member]

role.documentation: The amount after accumulated depreciation and amortization of physical assets such as land, improvements to land, easements, buildings, building improvements, vehicles, machinery, equipment, works of art and historical treasures, infrastructure, construction in progress, and all other tangible or intangible assets that have been, or will be, used in operations and that have initial useful lives extending beyond a single reporting period. Infrastructure assets are long-lived capital assets that normally are stationary in nature and can be preserved for a significantly greater number of years than most capital assets.
role.label: Capital Assets

role.documentation: Amount before accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization of physical assets used in the normal conduct of business and not intended for resale.
role.label: Capital Assets Being Depreciated

role.documentation: Net capital assets being depreciated.
role.label: Capital Assets Being Depreciated, Net

role.documentation: Capital assets, classified as depreciable.
role.label: Capital Assets, Depreciable (Net of Accumulated Depreciation and Amortization)
role.terseLabel: Capital Assets, Depreciable (Net of Accumulated Depreciation and Amortization)

role.documentation: Capital assets that are non depreciable or non amortizable.
role.label: Capital Assets Non Depreciable and NonAmortizable

role.documentation: Capital assets, classified as not being depreciated.
role.label: Capital Assets, Not Being Depreciated

role.documentation: Net capital assets, classified as not being depreciated.
role.label: Capital Assets, Not Being Depreciated, Net

role.documentation: Currency, coins, checks, money orders, and bankers' drafts on hand or on deposit with an official or agent designated as custodian of cash or demand deposits with financial institutions. Cash equivalents are short-term highly liquid investments including Treasury bills, commercial paper, and money market funds. Use PeriodEnd or PeriodStart labels to represent end of period or start of period balance.
role.label: Cash and Cash Equivalents

role.documentation: Cash and cash equivalents and investments includes not only currency on hand, but also demand deposits with banks or other financial institutions. Cash also includes deposits in other kinds of accounts or cash management pools that have the general characteristics of demand deposit accounts in that the governmental enterprise may deposit additional cash at any time and also effectively may withdraw cash at any time without prior notice or penalty. Investments amounts pertaining to a security or other asset that (a) a government holds primarily for the purpose of income or profit and (b) has a present service capacity based solely on its ability to generate cash or to be sold to generate cash.
role.label: Cash and Cash Equivalents and Investments

role.documentation: Represents other cash and cash equivalents that the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Cash includes not only currency on hand, but also demand deposits with banks or other financial institutions. Cash also includes deposits in other kinds of accounts or cash management pools that have the general characteristics of demand deposit accounts in that the governmental enterprise may deposit additional cash at any time and also effectively may withdraw cash at any time without prior notice or penalty.
role.label: Cash and Cash Equivalents, Others

role.documentation: Amount of increase (decrease) in cash and cash equivalents. Cash and cash equivalents are the amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Includes effect from exchange rate changes.
role.label: Net Increase (Decrease) in Cash

role.documentation: Cash and cash equivalents with fiscal agent.
role.label: Cash and Cash Equivalents with Fiscal Agent

role.documentation: Cash and cash equivalents with fiscal and escrow and other agents. Cash includes not only currency on hand, but also demand deposits with banks or other financial institutions. Cash also includes deposits in other kinds of accounts or cash management pools that have the general characteristics of demand deposit accounts in that the governmental enterprise may deposit additional cash at any time and also effectively may withdraw cash at any time without prior notice or penalty.
role.label: Cash and Cash Equivalents with Fiscal and Escrow and Other agents

role.documentation: Cash and cash equivalents with treasurer. Cash includes not only currency on hand, but also demand deposits with banks or other financial institutions. Cash also includes deposits in other kinds of accounts or cash management pools that have the general characteristics of demand deposit accounts in that the governmental enterprise may deposit additional cash at any time and also effectively may withdraw cash at any time without prior notice or penalty.
role.label: Cash and Cash Equivalents with Treasurer

role.documentation: Cash and cash equivalents with trustee. Cash includes not only currency on hand, but also demand deposits with banks or other financial institutions. Cash also includes deposits in other kinds of accounts or cash management pools that have the general characteristics of demand deposit accounts in that the governmental enterprise may deposit additional cash at any time and also effectively may withdraw cash at any time without prior notice or penalty.
role.label: Cash and Cash Equivalents with Trustee

role.documentation: Cash and investments. Cash includes not only currency on hand, but also demand deposits with banks or other financial institutions. Cash also includes deposits in other kinds of accounts or cash management pools that have the general characteristics of demand deposit accounts in that the governmental enterprise may deposit additional cash at any time and also effectively may withdraw cash at any time without prior notice or penalty. Investments amounts pertaining to a security or other asset that (a) a government holds primarily for the purpose of income or profit and (b) has a present service capacity based solely on its ability to generate cash or to be sold to generate cash.
role.label: Cash and Investments

role.documentation: Cash and investments in segregated accounts.
role.label: Cash and Investments in Segregated Accounts

role.documentation: Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Excludes cash and cash equivalents within disposal group and discontinued operation.
role.label: Cash and Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents

role.documentation: Information about cash flows from capital and related financing activities.
role.label: Cash Flows from Capital and Related Financing Activities [Abstract]

role.documentation: Information about cash flows from investing activities.
role.label: Cash Flows from Investing Activities [Abstract]

role.documentation: Information about cash flows from non capital financing activities.
role.label: Cash Flows from Non Capital Financing Activities [Abstract]

role.documentation: Information about cash flows from operating activities.
role.label: Cash Flows from Operating Activities [Abstract]

role.documentation: Cash from Interfund Activity.
role.label: Cash from Interfund Activity

role.documentation: Cash flows from operating activities.
role.label: Cash from Operations

role.documentation: Cash received from governmental agencies and nongovernmental parties that are for specific research projects, other types of programs , or for general institutional operations (if not government appropriations). Examples are research projects, training programs, student financial assistance, and similar activities for which amounts are received or expenses are reimbursable under the terms of a grant or contract, including amounts to cover both direct and indirect expenses. Includes Pell Grants and reimbursement for costs of administering federal financial aid programs.
role.label: Cash from Grants and Contracts

role.documentation: The net cash inflow or outflow in Interest-bearing deposits and securities.
role.label: Cash Provided by Interest on Investments

role.documentation: Cash receipts from grants for specific activities that are considered to be operating activities of the grantor government.
role.label: Cash Received from Operating Grants

role.documentation: The cash inflow from amounts in excess of par received from a long-term debt security issued by a state, certain agencies or authorities, a local government, or development corporation.
role.label: Cash Provided by Premiums on Bonds

role.documentation: The cash inflow from amounts received from a long-term debt security issued by a state, certain agencies or authorities, a local government, or development corporation.
role.label: Cash Provided by Sales of Bonds

role.documentation: The cash inflow from maturities and liquidations of all investments, including securities and other assets
role.label: Cash Provided by Proceeds from Sales and Maturities of Investments

role.documentation: Aggregate cash proceeds received from a combination of transactions that are classified as investing activities in which assets, which may include one or more investments, are sold to third-party buyers.
role.label: Cash Provided by Proceeds from Sales of Capital Assets

role.documentation: Cash inflows from sales of goods or services, including receipts from collection of accounts receivable and both short- and long-term notes receivable from customers arising from those sales.
role.label: Cash Flow from Sales and Services

role.documentation: State and local monies awarded to the institution under state and local student aid programs, including the state portion of State Student Incentives Grants (SSIG). (Used for reporting Student Financial Aid data).
role.label: Cash from State Appropriations

role.documentation: Education district taxes include all tax revenues assessed directly by an institution or on behalf of an institution when the institution will receive the exact amount collected. These revenues also include similar revenues that result from actions of local governments or citizens (such as through a referendum) that result in receipt by the institution of revenues based on collections of other taxes or resources (sales taxes, gambling taxes, etc.). Revenues from local government agencies that are for training programs and similar activities for which amounts are received or expenditures are reimbursable under the terms of a local government grant.
role.label: Cash from Real Estate Taxes and Corporate Personal Property Replacement Taxes

role.documentation: Cash received from all tuition and fees (less refunds, remissions, and exemptions) assessed against students for educational and general purposes.
role.label: Cash Flow from Tuition and Fees

role.documentation: Cash inflows from tenants for rents, fees and deposits.
role.label: Cash Received from Tenants

role.documentation: Cash received from Capital Contributions.
role.label: Cash Received from Capital Contributions

role.documentation: Cash inflows from sales of goods or services, including receipts from collection of accounts receivable and both short- and long-term notes receivable from customers arising from those sales.
role.label: Cash Received from Customers

role.documentation: Cash received from tap fees which are connection fees used to cover the cost of service installation which may include a tap, service line, water meter, excavation or boring costs, paving costs, etc.
role.label: Cash Received from Tap Fees

role.documentation: The cash outflow to pay off borrowing used to receive debt funding.
role.label: Cash Used in Bond Principal Payments

role.documentation: Cash outflows from housing assistance payments (HAP) for the Housing Choice Voucher (HCV) or similar type program paid or accrued to the owners of dwelling units leased to eligible families. Also included in this line is HAP related expenses such as contributions to FSS escrow accounts, utility reimbursements, and mortgage payments paid using HAP subsidy for a HCV homeownership program. In addition this account includes, where applicable, HAP payments paid or accrued to owners for vacancies during and after rent-up pursuant to a housing assistance payments contract, and HAP payments paid or accrued to owners for reimbursement pursuant to the provisions of the housing assistance contract for any unpaid rent or damages caused by the tenants.
role.label: Cash Housing Assistance Payments

role.documentation: Amount of cash paid for interest, excluding capitalized interest. Includes, but is not limited to, payment to settle zero-coupon bond for accreted interest of debt discount and debt instrument with insignificant coupon interest rate in relation to effective interest rate of borrowing attributable to accreted interest of debt discount.
role.label: Cash Used in Interest Paid on Bonds

role.documentation: Cash payments to employees for services.
role.label: Cash Payments to Employees

role.documentation: Cash payments to landlords.
role.label: Cash Payments to Landlords

role.documentation: Cash payments to other suppliers for other goods or services.
role.label: Cash Payments to Suppliers

role.documentation: Amount of cash outflow from investing activities, including discontinued operations. Investing activity cash flows include making loans and acquiring of debt or equity instruments and property, plant, and equipment and other productive assets.
role.label: Cashed Used in Purchase of Investments

role.documentation: The cash outflow for purchases of and capital improvements on property, plant and equipment (capital expenditures).
role.label: Cash Used in Purchases of Capital Assets

role.documentation: Amount of cash with escrow agent.
role.label: Cash With Escrow Agent

role.documentation: Value of a change in an accounting principle which is a change in a method used, such as using a different depreciation method or switching between LIFO to FIFO inventory valuation methods.
role.label: Change in Accounting Principle

role.documentation: Changes in fair value of investments. Investment amounts pertaining to a security or other asset that (a) a government holds primarily for the purpose of income or profit and (b) has a present service capacity based solely on its ability to generate cash or to be sold to generate cash.
role.label: Changes in Fair Value of Investments

role.documentation: Changes in net position which is the difference in net position between the beginning and end of the reporting period.
role.label: Changes in Net Position

role.documentation: Changes in net position for business type activities.
role.label: Changes in Net Position, Business Type Activities

role.documentation: Adjusted changes in net position for business type activities for enterprise funds.
role.label: Changes in Net Position, Business Type Activities, Enterprise Funds, Adjusted

role.documentation: Changes in net position for business type activities for enterprise funds.
role.label: Changes in Net Position, Business Type Activities, Enterprise Funds

role.documentation: Claims and judgments payable.
role.label: Claims and Judgments Payable

role.documentation: Claims and judgments receivable.
role.label: Claims and Judgments Receivable

role.documentation: Compensated absences payable are compensated time off such as vacation and sick leave, which has been earned by employees and probable that the employer will compensate the employees through paid time off or some other means, such as cash payments at termination or retirement but not yet compensated by the employer.
role.label: Compensated Absences Payable

role.documentation: Compensated absences payable, classified as current. Compensated absences are compensated time off such as vacation and sick leave, which has been earned by employees and probable that the employer will compensate the employees through paid time off or some other means, such as cash payments at termination or retirement but not yet compensated by the employer.
role.label: Compensated Absences Payable, Current

role.documentation: Compensated absences payable, matured.
role.label: Compensated Absences Payable, Matured

role.documentation: Compensated absences payable, classified as noncurrent. Compensated absences are compensated time off such as vacation and sick leave, which has been earned by employees and probable that the employer will compensate the employees through paid time off or some other means, such as cash payments at termination or retirement but not yet compensated by the employer.
role.label: Compensated Absences Payable, Noncurrent

role.documentation: Compensated absences payable, classified as noncurrent. Compensated absences are compensated time off such as vacation and sick leave, which has been earned by employees and probable that the employer will compensate the employees through paid time off or some other means, such as cash payments at termination or retirement but not yet compensated by the employer.
role.label: Compensated Absences Payable, Noncurrent

role.documentation: Represents information related to a discretely presented component unit, part of the reporting entity but external to the primary government.
role.label: Component Unit Discretely Presented [Axis]

role.documentation: Represents information related to a component unit and covers extraneous reporting.
role.label: Component Unit Discretely Presented [Domain]

role.documentation: Legally separate organizations for which the elected officials of the primary government are financially accountable. In addition, a component unit can be another organization for which the nature and significance of its relationship with a primary government is such that exclusion would cause the reporting entity's financial statements to be misleading or incomplete.
role.label: Component Unit Discretely Presented [Member]

role.documentation: Computer software is a common type of intangible asset that is often internally generated. Computer software should be considered internally generated if it is developed in-house by the government’s personnel or by a third-party contractor on behalf of the government. Commercially available software that is purchased or licensed by the government and modified using more than minimal incremental effort before being put into operation also should be considered internally generated.
role.label: Computer Software

role.documentation: Amount of structure or a modification to a structure under construction. Includes recently completed structures or modifications to structures that have not been placed into service.
role.label: Construction in Progress

role.documentation: Amount of capital contributions.
role.label: Contributions, Capital

role.documentation: Contributions from primary government.
role.label: Contributions from Primary Government

role.documentation: Amount of contributions classified as other. Contributions to term and permanent endowments, contributions to permanent fund principal, special and extraordinary items (defined in paragraphs .145 and .146), and transfers (defined in paragraph .102) between governmental and business-type activities should each be reported separately from, but in the same manner as, general revenues.
role.label: Contributions, Other

role.documentation: Amount of contributions to government from citizens and developers.
role.label: Contributions from Citizens and Developers

role.documentation: Cost of issue of bonds and securities.
role.label: Cost of Issue of Bonds and Securities

role.documentation: Current Assets.
role.label: Current Assets

role.documentation: Information about Current Assets.
role.label: Current Assets [Abstract]

role.documentation: Current liabilities are amount of obligations for items that have entered into the operating cycle incurred in the acquisition of materials and supplies to be used in providing services; collections received in advance of the performance of services.
role.label: Current Liabilities

role.documentation: Information about Current Liabilities.
role.label: Current Liabilities [Abstract]

role.documentation: Obligations payable from restricted assets whose liquidation is reasonably expected to require the use of existing resources properly classifiable as current assets, or the creation of other current liabilities.
role.label: Current Liabilities Payable from Resticted Assets

role.documentation: Information about other current liabilities payable from restricted assets.
role.label: Current Liabilities Payable from Restricted Assets [Abstract]

role.documentation: Debt servicing of interest and fiscal charges. Interest and fiscal charges covers debt service payments other than principal repayment.
role.label: Debt Servicing of Interest and Fiscal Charges

role.documentation: Debt servicing of principal repayment.
role.label: Debt Servicing of Principal Repayment

role.documentation: Gains from the issuance of new debt whose proceeds are used to repay previously issued debt
role.label: Deferred Amount on Refunding

role.documentation: When property taxes receivable are recognized, or when property taxes are collected in advance of the period for which they are levied, they should be recorded as a deferred inflow of resources
role.label: Deferred Property Tax Revenues

role.documentation: Acquisition of net assets applicable to changes in the employer’s proportion and differences between (a) the amounts paid by the employer for OPEBs as the benefits came due and (b) the employer’s proportionate share of the total of certain amounts paid by the employer and nonemployer contributing entities for OPEBs as the benefits came due.
role.label: Deferred Inflows of Resources, OPEB, Changes in Proportion and Differences Between Employer Contributions and Share of Contributions

role.documentation: Acquisition of net assets applicable to changes in the employer’s proportion and differences between (a) the amounts paid by the employer for pensions as the benefits came due and (b) the employer’s proportionate share of the total of certain amounts paid by the employer and nonemployer contributing entities for pensions as the benefits came due
role.label: Deferred Inflows of Resources, Pensions, Changes in Proportion and Differences Between Employer Contributions and Share of Contributions

role.documentation: Deferred inflows of resources represents an acquisition of net position by the government that is applicable to a future reporting period.
role.label: Deferred Inflows of Resources

role.documentation: Information about deferred inflows of resources
role.label: Deferred Inflows of Resources [Abstract]

role.documentation: Acquisition of debt related net assets that applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an inflow of resources (revenue) until that time.
role.label: Deferred Inflows of Resources, Debt Items

role.documentation: Acquisition of OPEB related net assets that applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an inflow of resources (revenue) until that time.
role.label: Deferred Inflows of Resources, OPEB Items

role.documentation: Acquisition of OPEB related net assets deferred due to changes in assumptions about future economic and demographic factors such as inflation, health care costs trend rates, salary changes, ad hoc post‐employment benefit changes, and mortality rates. Applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an inflow of resources (revenue) until then.
role.label: Deferred Inflows of Resources, OPEB Items, Changes in Assumptions

role.documentation: Acquisition of OPEB related net assets due to contributions to the OPEB plan made subsequent to the measurement date and prior to the reporting date. Applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an inflow of resources (revenue) until then.
role.label: Deferred Inflows of Resources, OPEB Items, Contributions Made After Measurement Date

role.documentation: Acquisition of other net assets not classified elsewhere related net assets that applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an inflow of resources (revenue) until that time.
role.label: Deferred Inflows of Resources, Other Items

role.documentation: Acquisition of pension related net assets that applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an inflow of resources (revenue) until that time. May also include OPEB items.
role.label: Deferred Inflows of Resources, Pension Items

role.documentation: Acquisition of pension related net assets deferred due to changes in assumptions about future economic and demographic factors such as inflation, health care costs trend rates, salary changes, ad hoc post‐employment benefit changes, and mortality rates. Applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an inflow of resources (revenue) until then.
role.label: Deferred Inflows of Resources, Pension Items, Changes in Assumptions

role.documentation: Acquisition of pension related net assets due to contributions to the pension plan made subsequent to the measurement date and prior to the reporting date. Applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an inflow of resources (revenue) until then.
role.label: Deferred Inflows of Resources, Pension Items, Contributions Made After Measurement Date

role.documentation: Accumulation of property tax revenue that applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an inflow of resources (revenue) until that time.
role.label: Deferred Inflows of Resources, Unavailable Property Tax Revenue

role.documentation: Acquisition of OPEB related net assets deferred due to differences between expected and actuarial experience with regard to economic or demographic factors. Applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an inflow of resources (revenue) until then.
role.label: Deferred Inflows of Resources, OPEB Items, Difference between Expected and Actual Experience

role.documentation: Acquisition of OPEB related net assets arising from difference between projected and actual OPEB plan investment earnings. Applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an inflow of resources (revenue) until then.

In addition this account includes, where applicable, HAP payments paid or accrued to owners for vacancies during and after rent-up pursuant to a housing assistance payments contract, and HAP payments paid or accrued to owners for reimbursement pursuant to the provisions of the housing assistance contract for any unpaid rent or damages caused by the tenants.

role.documentation: Instruction consists of those activities dealing directly with the teaching of students. It includes the activities of faculty in the baccalaureate-oriented/transfer, occupational-technical career, general studies, and remedial and ABE/ASE programs (associate degree credit and certificate credit). It includes expenditures for department chairpersons, administrators, and support staff for whom instruction is an important role. It also includes all equipment, materials, supplies, and costs that are necessary to support the instructional program. Instructional salaries ordinarily will be allocated among the subprograms (instructional area) according to teaching assignment. If this is not possible (or immaterial), instructional salaries should be reported under the subprogram (instructional area) that best reflects the employee's primary area of assignment.
role.label: Expenditures for Instruction

role.documentation: Used to represent a governmental fund. If the fund is General or Aggregate Nonmajor, should be used with the enumerated element FundType with value reported as General Fund or Aggregate Nonmajor. If the fund is categorized as Special Revenue, Capital Project, Debt Service, Permanent, or Other, use the FundType element to indicate the fund type, and use the element FundName to specify the government-specific fund name, for example "Public Education" or "Transportation". FundName should not be used for funds that are categorized as General Fund or Aggregate Nonmajor.

If the fund is Special Revenue, Capital Project, Debt Service, Permanent, or Other, this element should be used with the FundName element to identify the government fund, and with the FundIdentifierAxis. If it is a General Fund or Aggregate Nonmajor Fund, use it with the FundIdentifierAxis but do not use the FundName element.

role.documentation: Governmental activities which are generally are financed through taxes, intergovernmental revenues, and other non-exchange revenues. These activities are usually reported in governmental funds and internal service funds.
role.label: Governmental Activities [Member]

role.documentation: Information on the Governmental Funds Balance Sheet.
role.label: Governmental Funds Balance Sheet [Abstract]

role.documentation: Information about the Governmental Funds Statement of Revenues and Expenditures and Changes in Fund Balance.
role.label: Governmental Funds Statement of Revenues, Expenditures and Changes in Fund Balance [Abstract]

role.documentation: Grants, contributions and donations from federal governmental entities.
role.label: Grants, Contributions and Donations from Federal Governmental Entities

role.documentation: Grants, contributions and donations from local governmental entities.
role.label: Grants, Contributions and Donations from Local Governmental Entities

role.documentation: Grants, contributions and donations from others when the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.
role.label: Grants, Contributions and Donations from Others

role.documentation: Grants, contributions and donations from state governmental entities.
role.label: Grants, Contributions and Donations from State Governmental Entities

role.documentation: Grants payable.
role.label: Grants Payable

role.documentation: Grants receivable.
role.label: Grants Receivable

role.documentation: Income (loss) before capital contributions.
role.label: Income (Loss) before Capital Contributions

role.documentation: Income tax receivable which are taxes derived from state income tax.
role.label: Income Tax Receivable

role.documentation: An intangible asset is classified as a capital assets. It is an asset that lacks physical substance, is nonfinancial in nature, and has an initial useful life extending beyond a single reporting period.
role.label: Intangible Assets

role.documentation: Inter-funds balances payable, which have a requirement for repayment, and which are reported as inter-fund receivables in lender funds and inter-fund payables in borrower funds. This activity should not be reported as other financing sources or uses in the fund financial statements. If repayment is not expected within a reasonable time, the inter-fund balances should be reduced and the amount that is not expected to be repaid should be reported as a transfer from the fund that made the loan to the fund that received the loan.
role.label: Inter Funds Balances Payable

role.documentation: Inter-funds balances receivable which have a requirement for repayment, and which are reported as inter-fund receivables in lender funds and inter-fund payables in borrower funds. This activity should not be reported as other financing sources or uses in the fund financial statements. If repayment is not expected within a reasonable time, the inter-fund balances should be reduced and the amount that is not expected to be repaid should be reported as a transfer from the fund that made the loan to the fund that received the loan.
role.label: Inter Funds Balances Receivable

role.documentation: Inter-governmental balances payable is appropriate where one governmental unit transfers resources to another, such as when states transfer shared revenues to local governments or act as an Intermediary in federally financed programs.
role.label: Inter Governmental Payable

role.documentation: Inter-governmental receivable is appropriate where one governmental unit transfers resources to another, such as when states transfer shared revenues to local governments or act as an Intermediary in federally financed programs.
role.label: Inter Governmental Receivable

role.documentation: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of interest earned but not received. Also called accrued interest or accrued interest receivable.
role.label: Interest Receivable

role.documentation: The portion of interest receivable estimated not to be collectible.
role.label: Allowance for Uncollectible Interest

role.documentation: The interest portion of any amount representing an agreement for an unconditional promise by the maker to pay the Entity (holder) a definite sum of money at a future date(s) beyongwithin one year of the balance sheet date.
role.label: Interest Receivable on Long Term notes

role.documentation: Internal balances receivable, which are net residual amounts due between governmental and business-type activities in the government-wide statement of net position.
role.label: Internal Balances Receivable

role.documentation: Internal balances payable, which are the net residual amounts due between governmental and business-type activities.
role.label: Internal Balances Payable

role.documentation: Inventories, which are materials and supplies on hand for future consumption or goods held for resale rather than for use in operations.
role.label: Inventories

role.documentation: Inventories, classified as current, which are materials and supplies on hand for future consumption or goods held for resale rather than for use in operations.
role.label: Inventories, Current

role.documentation: Inventories, classified as noncurrent, which are materials and supplies on hand for future consumption or goods held for resale rather than for use in operations.
role.label: Inventories, Noncurrent

role.documentation: Investment income receivable, which is the compensation for the use of financial resources over a period of time.
role.label: Investment Income Receivable

role.documentation: Sum of investments and unrestricted cash as of the balance sheet date.
role.label: Investments

role.documentation: Securities that are expected to be held for less than one year and that generate revenue in the form of interest or dividents.
role.label: Investments, Current

role.documentation: Investments in associates, which is the amounts pertaining to a security or other asset that (a) a government holds primarily for the purpose of income or profit and (b) has a present service capacity based solely on its ability to generate cash or to be sold to generate cash.
role.label: Investments in Associates

role.documentation: Investments in joint ventures, which is the amounts pertaining to a security or other asset that (a) a government holds primarily for the purpose of income or profit and (b) has a present service capacity based solely on its ability to generate cash or to be sold to generate cash.
role.label: Investments in Joint Ventures

role.documentation: Investments in subsidiaries, which is the amounts pertaining to a security or other asset that (a) a government holds primarily for the purpose of income or profit and (b) has a present service capacity based solely on its ability to generate cash or to be sold to generate cash.
role.label: Investments in Subsidiaries

role.documentation: Investments with fiscal agents, which is the amounts pertaining to a security or other asset that (a) a government holds primarily for the purpose of income or profit and (b) has a present service capacity based solely on its ability to generate cash or to be sold to generate cash.
role.label: Investments with Fiscal Agents

role.documentation: Investments with state treasury, which is the amounts pertaining to a security or other asset that (a) a government holds primarily for the purpose of income or profit and (b) has a present service capacity based solely on its ability to generate cash or to be sold to generate cash.
role.label: Investments with State Treasury

role.documentation: Amount before accumulated depletion of real estate held for productive use, excluding land held for sale.
role.label: Land

role.documentation: Leases payable.
role.label: Leases Payable

role.documentation: Leases receivable.
role.label: Leases Receivable

role.documentation: Liabilities are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid. See GASB COD Appendix B under the summary.
role.label: Liabilities

role.documentation: Information about liabilities.
role.label: Liabilities [Abstract]

role.documentation: Summation of liabilities and deferred inflows of resources.
role.label: Liabilities and Deferred Inflows of Resources

role.documentation: Loan guarantee liabilities, for example direct student loans.

role.documentation: Loans payable.

role.documentation: Loans receivable.

role.documentation: An amount representing an agreement for an unconditional promise by the maker to pay the Entity (holder) a definite sum of money at a future date(s) beyongwithin one year of the balance sheet date.
role.label: Long Term Notes Receivable

role.documentation: Net assets.
role.label: Net Assets

role.documentation: Net assets and deferred outflows of resources.
role.label: Net Assets and Deferred Outflows of Resources

role.documentation: Cash flows from (a) acquiring and disposing of capital assets used in providing services or producing goods, (b) borrowing money for acquiring, constructing, or improving capital assets and repaying the amounts borrowed, including interest, and (c) paying for capital assets obtained from vendors on credit.
role.label: Net Cash from Capital and Related Financing Activities

role.documentation: Cash flows from borrowing money for purposes other than to acquire, construct, or improve capital assets and repaying those amounts borrowed, including interest. This category includes proceeds from all borrowings (such as revenue anticipation notes) not clearly attributable to acquisition, construction, or improvement of capital assets, regardless of the form of the borrowing. Also included are certain other interfund and intergovernmental receipts and payments
role.label: Net Cash from Non Capital Financing Activities

role.documentation: Cash flows from making and collecting loans (except program loans, as discussed in paragraph .116Open this link as a new document) and acquiring and disposing of debt or equity instruments.
role.label: Net Cash from Investing Activities

role.documentation: Cash flows from from providing services and producing and delivering goods, and include all transactions and other events that are not defined as capital and related financing, noncapital financing, or investing activities. Cash flows from operating activities generally are the cash effects of transactions and other events that enter into the determination of operating income.
role.label: Net Cash Provided By (Used in) Operating Activities

role.documentation: Amount of net change in fund balance.
role.label: Net Change in Fund Balance

role.documentation: Net of expenses and revenues.
role.label: Net (Expense) Revenue

role.documentation: Net investment in capital assets.
role.label: Net Investment in Capital Assets

role.documentation: Net liabilities.
role.label: Net Liabilities

role.documentation: Net liabilities and deferrred inflows of resources.
role.label: Net Liabilities and Deferred Inflows of Resources

role.documentation: Net liabilities and deferrred inflows of resources and fund balances.
role.label: Net Liabilities and Deferred Inflows of Resources and Fund Balances

role.documentation: An employer's net OPEB obligation is defined as the cumulative difference between annual OPEB cost and the employer's contributions to a plan, including the OPEB liability or asset at transition, if any. Use this concept when there is an OPEB asset.
role.label: Net OPEB Asset

role.documentation: An employer's net OPEB obligation is defined as the cumulative difference between annual OPEB cost and the employer's contributions to a plan, including the OPEB liability or asset at transition, if any. Use this concept when there is an OPEB liability.
role.label: Net OPEB Liability

role.documentation: Net pension asset.
role.label: Net Pension Asset

role.documentation: Net pension liability.
role.label: Net Pension Liability

role.documentation: Net position represents the difference between all other elements in a statement of net position and should be displayed in three components namely net investment in capital assets, restricted (distinguishing between major categories of restrictions), and unrestricted. Use PeriodEnd or PeriodStart labels to represent end of period or start of period balance.
role.label: Net Position
role.periodEndLabel: Net Position at End of Period
role.periodStartLabel: Net Position at Beginning of Period (Before Adjustment)

role.documentation: Information about net position.
role.label: Net Position [Abstract]

role.documentation: Net position at beginning of period (after adjustments). Amounts reflected as the opening balance of net position after adjustments.
role.label: Net Position at Beginning of Period (After Adjustments)

role.documentation: Net position, restated.
role.label: Net Position, Restated

role.documentation: Net transfers. A transfer is a flow of assets (such as cash or goods) without equivalent flows of assets in return and without a requirement for repayment. This category includes payments in lieu of taxes that are not payments for, and are not reasonably equivalent in value to, services provided. In governmental funds, transfers should be reported as other financing uses in the funds making transfers and as other financing sources in the funds receiving transfers. In proprietary funds, transfers should be reported after nonoperating revenues and expenses.
role.label: Net Transfers

role.documentation: noncurrent assets.
role.label: Noncurrent Assets

role.documentation: Information about noncurrent assets.
role.label: Noncurrent Assets [Abstract]

role.documentation: noncurrent liabilities, which are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid.
role.label: Noncurrent Liabilities

role.documentation: Information about noncurrent liabilities.
role.label: Noncurrent Liabilities [Abstract]

role.documentation: Obligations scheduled to mature beyond one year from the date of a government’s financial statements and payable from restricted assets.
role.label: Noncurrent Liabilities Payable from Restricted Assets

role.documentation: noncurrent assets.
role.label: Noncurrent Assets

role.documentation: noncurrent liabilities, which are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid.
role.label: Noncurrent Liabilities

role.documentation: Noncurrent liabilities, due within one year, which are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid.
role.label: Noncurrent Liabilities Due Within One Year
role.terseLabel: Noncurrent Liabilities Due Within One Year

role.documentation: Noncurrent liabilities, due in more than one year, which are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid.
role.label: Noncurrent Liabilities Due in More Than One Year
role.terseLabel: Noncurrent Liabilities Due in More Than One Year

role.documentation: The aggregate amount of gains or losses resulting from nonoperating activities (for example, interest and dividend revenue, property, plant and equipment impairment loss, and so forth).
role.label: Nonoperating Gains (Losses)

role.documentation: Information about nonoperating revenues and expenses.
role.label: Nonoperating Revenues Expenses [Abstract]

role.documentation: Notes payable.
role.label: Notes Payable

role.documentation: Notes receivable.
role.label: Notes Receivable

role.documentation: An amount representing an agreement for an unconditional promise by the maker to pay the Entity (holder) a definite sum of money at a future date(s) within one year of the balance sheet date. Such amount may include accrued interest receivable in accordance with the terms of the note. The note also may contain provisions including a discount or premium, payable on demand, secured, or unsecured, interest bearing or noninterest bearing, among myriad other features and characteristics.
role.label: Notes Receivable, Short Term

role.documentation: Information about OPEB.
role.label: OPEB [Abstract]

role.documentation: Actual OPEB contribution made by the state and other entities.
role.label: Actual OPEB Contribution Made By the State and Other Entities

role.documentation: Actual OPEB contribution made by employees.
role.label: Actual OPEB Contribution Made By Employees

role.documentation: Actual OPEB contribution made by the employer.
role.label: Actual OPEB Contribution Made By the Employer

role.documentation: The date as of which an actuarial valuation is performed.
role.label: OPEB Actuarial Valuation Date

role.documentation: A target or recommended contribution to a defined benefit OPEB plan for the reporting period, determined in conformity with Actuarial Standards of Practice based on the most recent measurement available when the contribution for the reporting period was adopted.
role.label: Actuarially Determined OPEB Contribution

role.documentation: OPEB plan Administrative Expenses
role.label: OPEB Plan Administrative Expenses

role.documentation: Other post-employment benefits plan, classified as asset. Represents the government's total liability for other post-employment benefits less the fiduciary net position of OPEB plans in which the government has an interest.
role.label: OPEB, Asset

role.documentation: The rates of change in per capita health claims costs over time as a result of factors such as medical inflation, utilization of healthcare services, plan design, and technological developments.
role.label: OPEB Assumed Healthcare Cost Trend Rate

role.documentation: OPEB assumed inflation rate.
role.label: OPEB Assumed Inflation Rate

role.documentation: OPEB assumed rate of return.
role.label: OPEB Assumed Rate of Return

role.documentation: OPEB assumed salary growth.
role.label: OPEB Assumed Salary Growth

role.documentation: Benefit payments made by the OPEB plan.
role.label: Benefit Payments Made By the OPEB Plan

role.documentation: The payroll amount on which contributions to an OPEB plan are based.
role.label: OPEB Plan Covered Payroll

role.documentation: The single rate of return that, when applied to all projected benefit payments, results in an actuarial present value of projected benefit payments.
role.label: OPEB Discount Rate

role.documentation: Employer’s required contributions to the OPEB plan for the reporting period, and separate liabilities to the OPEB plan that arise in the reporting period (for example, for amounts assessed to an individual employer upon joining a cost-sharing OPEB plan).
role.label: OPEB Expense

role.documentation: The net asset or liability of employers and nonemployer contributing entities to employees for benefits provided through a defined benefit OPEB plan.
role.label: Net OPEB Asset/Liability also known as Fiduciary Net Position

role.documentation: OPEB Funded Ratio
role.label: OPEB Funded Ratio

role.documentation: OPEB plan interest cost.
role.label: OPEB Plan Interest Cost

role.documentation: Other post-employment benefits plan, classified as liability, defined as the government's total liability for other post-employment benefits less the fiduciary net position of OPEB plans in which the government has an interest.
role.label: OPEB Liability

role.documentation: Net OPEB liability (i.e., Fiduciary Net Position) calculated using a healthcare cost trend rate that is 1-percentage-point lower than the assumed healthcare cost trend rate.
role.label: Net OPEB Liability at Assumed Healthcare Cost Trend Minus 1%

role.documentation: Net OPEB liability (i.e., Fiduciary Net Position) calculated using a healthcare cost trend rate that is 1-percentage-point higher than the assumed healthcare cost trend rate.
role.label: Net OPEB Liability at Assumed Healthcare Cost Trend Plus 1%

role.documentation: Net Investment Income earned by the OPEB plan.
role.label: Net Investment Income Earned by the OPEB Plan

role.documentation: Net OPEB liability (i.e., Fiduciary Net Position) calculated using a discount rate that is 1-percentage-point lower than the assumed discount rate.
role.label: Net OPEB Liability At Assumed Discount Rate Minus 1%

role.documentation: Net OPEB liability (i.e., Fiduciary Net Position) calculated using a discount rate that is 1-percentage-point higher than the assumed discount rate.
role.label: Net OPEB Liability At Assumed Discount Rate Plus 1%

role.documentation: Number of individuals employed at the end of the reporting or measurement period, as applicable.
role.label: OPEB Plan Active Employees

role.documentation: OPEB Plan Assets
role.label: OPEB Plan Assets

role.documentation: Indicates the type of employees participating in the OPEB plan, which could be Fire, Police, Public Safety, Teachers, Miscellaneous, Elected Officials or Other.
role.label: Type of Employees Participating in OPEB Plan

role.documentation: OPEB plan employer contributions.
role.label: OPEB Plan Employer Contributions

role.documentation: OPEB plan gain/loss assumption changes.
role.label: OPEB Plan Gain/Loss Assumption Changes

role.documentation: OPEB plan gain/loss difference between actual and expected experience.
role.label: OPEB Plan Gain/Loss Difference Between Actual and Expected Experience

role.documentation: OPEB plan liability measurement date.
role.label: OPEB Plan Liability Measurement Date

role.documentation: OPEB plan member contributions.
role.label: OPEB Plan Member Contributions

role.documentation: OPEB plan name.
role.label: OPEB Plan Name

role.documentation: Used for identifiers for Pension Plans.
role.label: OPEB Plan Name [Axis]

role.documentation: OPEB plan other changes to liability.
role.label: OPEB Plan Other Changes to Liability

role.documentation: Number of OPEB plan retired employees.
role.label: OPEB Plan Retired Employees

role.documentation: Indicates if the OPEB plan is closed or open.
role.label: OPEB Plan Status

role.documentation: Number of inactive employees who have accumulated benefits under the terms of an OPEB plan but are not yet receiving benefit payments.
role.label: OPEB Plan Terminated Employees Entitled To But Not Yet Receiving Benefits

role.documentation: The portion of the actuarial present value of projected benefit payments that is attributed to past periods of employee service in conformity with the requirements of this section. The total OPEB liability is the liability of employers and nonemployer contributing entities to employees for benefits provided through a defined benefit OPEB plan
role.label: Total OPEB Liabilities

role.documentation: Indicates if the OPEB plan is single, multi-employer agency or multi-employer cost-sharing.
role.label: OPEB Plan Type

role.documentation: Used to collect information about OPEB Plans.
role.label: OPEB Plans [Line Items]

role.documentation: Table used to capture information about the OPEB Plans.
role.label: OPEB Plans [Table]

role.documentation: The portions of the actuarial present value of projected benefit payments that are attributed to valuation years.
role.label: OPEB Plan Service Cost

role.documentation: Amount before accumulated depreciation and depletion of additions or improvements to real estate held for productive use. Examples include, but are not limited to, walkways, driveways, fences, and parking lots.
role.label: On Site Improvements

role.documentation: Operating expenses are those expenses directly attributable to the operations of the College. Incidental expenses are classified as non-operating expenses.
role.label: Operating Expense

role.documentation: Information about operating expenses.
role.label: Operating Expenses [Abstract]

role.documentation: The net result for the period of deducting operating expenses from operating revenues.
role.label: Operating Income (Loss)

role.documentation: Information about operating revenues.
role.label: Operating Revenues [Abstract]

role.documentation: Not elsewhere classified fees and other revenue recorded based on estimates or specific contractual terms as transactions occur or services are rendered, provided that persuasive evidence exists, the price to the customer is fixed or determinable and collectability is reasonably assured, which have not yet been received as of the balance sheet date.
role.label: Other Accounts Receivable

role.documentation: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable, pertaining to costs that are statutory in nature, are incurred on contractual obligations, or accumulate over time and for which invoices have not yet been received or will not be rendered and not elsewehere classified.
role.label: Other Accrued Liabilities

role.documentation: Other assets which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Assets are resources with present service capacity that the government presently controls.
role.label: Other Assets

role.documentation: Other types of capital assets which are physical assets used in the normal conduct of business and not intended for sale.
role.label: Other Capital Assets

role.documentation: Other cash flows from capital and financing related activities.
role.label: Other Cash Flows from Capital and Financing Related Activities

role.documentation: Other cash flows from investing activities.
role.label: Other Cash Flows from Investing Activities

role.documentation: Other cash flows from non capital financing activities, not elsewhere classified.
role.label: Other Cash Flows from Non Capital Financing Activities

role.documentation: Other cash flows from operating activities, not elsewhere classified.
role.label: Other Cash Flows from Operating Activities

role.documentation: Other current assets which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement.
role.label: Other Current Assets

role.documentation: Other current investments which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Investments amounts pertaining to a security or other asset that (a) a government holds primarily for the purpose of income or profit and (b) has a present service capacity based solely on its ability to generate cash or to be sold to generate cash.
role.label: Other Current Investments

role.documentation: Other current liabilities which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Liabilities are amount of obligations for items that have entered into the operating cycle incurred in the acquisition of materials and supplies to be used in providing services; collections received in advance of the performance of services.
role.label: Other Current Liabilities

role.documentation: Other current liabilities payable from restricted assets.
role.label: Other Current Liabilities Payable from Restricted Assets

role.documentation: Other deferred inflows of resources.
role.label: Other Deferred Inflows of Resources

role.documentation: Other deferred inflow of resources which is an acquisition of net assets by the government that is applicable to a future reporting period.

role.documentation: Other expenditures which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.
role.label: Other Expenditures

role.documentation: Other expenses which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.
role.label: Other Expenses

role.documentation: Other financing sources (uses) which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. It includes a limited number of special transactions that are used to account for non-operating revenues or receipts and expenditures or disbursements . Included in this financial reporting category are operating transfers (inflow) and proceeds from debt transactions.
role.label: Other Financing Sources (Uses)

role.documentation: Information about other financing sources and uses.
role.label: Other Financing Sources (Uses) [Abstract]

role.documentation: Other general revenues which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. All revenues are general revenues unless they are required to be reported as program revenues.
role.label: Other General Revenues

role.documentation: Other investments which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Investment income is the compensation for the use of financial resources over a period of time.
role.label: Other Investments

role.documentation: Other liabilities which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Liabilities are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid.
role.label: Other Liabilities

role.documentation: Other noncurrent assets which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.
role.label: Other Noncurrent Assets

role.documentation: Information about other noncurrent assets.
role.label: Other Noncurrent Assets [Abstract]

role.documentation: Other noncurrent investments which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Investments amounts pertaining to a security or other asset that (a) a government holds primarily for the purpose of income or profit and (b) has a present service capacity based solely on its ability to generate cash or to be sold to generate cash.
role.label: Other Noncurrent Investments

role.documentation: Other noncurrent liabilities which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Liabilities are amount of obligations for items that have entered into the operating cycle incurred in the acquisition of materials and supplies to be used in providing services; collections received in advance of the performance of services.
role.label: Other Noncurrent Liabilities

role.documentation: Other noncurrent liabilities, due within one year, which are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid.
role.label: Other Noncurrent Liabilities Due Within One Year

role.documentation: Other noncurrent liabilities, due in more than one year, which are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid.
role.label: Other Noncurrent Liabilities Due in More Than One Year

role.documentation: Obligations scheduled to mature beyond one year from the date of a government’s financial statements not elsewhere classified and payable from restricted assets.

role.documentation: Other nonoperating revenues or expenses.

role.documentation: Total assets that cannot be used for operating purposes because of contract or regulatory requirements that are in effect for a period that extends beyond one year.

role.documentation: Other restricted components of net position which consists of restricted assets reduced by liabilities and deferred inflows of resources related to those assets.

role.terseLabel: Other Restricted Components of Net Position

role.documentation: Other types of restricted assets. Assets should be reported as restricted when restrictions on asset use change the nature or normal understanding of the availability of the asset.

role.documentation: Other revenues which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.

role.documentation: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of other unrestricted assets that are expected to be realized in cash, sold, or consumed within one year.

role.label: Net Pension Liability At Assumed Discount Rate Plus 1%

role.label: Total Pension Liabilities

role.documentation: Pooled investments. Investments amounts pertaining to a security or other asset that (a) a government holds primarily for the purpose of income or profit and (b) has a present service capacity based solely on its ability to generate cash or to be sold to generate cash.

role.documentation: Revenue from business license tax.

role.documentation: Revenue from charges for services and sales. Charges for services includes charges to customers, applicants, or others who purchase, use, or directly benefit from the goods, services, or privileges provided, or are otherwise directly affected by the services. Includes revenue from fees charged for specific services, such as water use or garbage collection; licenses and permits, such as dog licenses, liquor licenses, and building permits; operating special assessments, such as for street cleaning or special street lighting; and any other amounts charged to service recipients. Fines and forfeitures are also included in this category because they result from direct charges to those who are otherwise directly affected by a program or service, even though they receive no benefit. Should also include payments from other governments for goods or services—for example, when County A reimburses County B for boarding County A's prisoners.
role.label: Revenue From Charges for Services and Sales

role.documentation: Revenue used for sanitary sewer services.
role.label: Revenue Used For Sanitary Sewer Services

role.documentation: Revenue used for security of persons and property services.
role.label: Revenue Used For Security of Persons and Property Services

role.documentation: Revenue used for storm sewer services.
role.label: Revenue Used For Storm Sewer Services

role.documentation: Revenue used for transportation services.
role.label: Revenue Used For Transportation Services

role.documentation: Revenue used for water supply services.
role.label: Revenue Used For Water Supply Services

role.documentation: Revenue from auxiliary enterprises.
role.label: Revenue From Auxiliary Enterprises

role.documentation: Revenues that are generated by a government itself, such as tax revenues and water and sewer charges. Investment income is also an own-source revenue. Intergovernmental aid and shared revenues are not own-source revenues.
role.label: Revenues

role.documentation: Information about revenues.
role.label: Revenues [Abstract]

role.documentation: Revenues, net.
role.label: Revenues, Net

role.documentation: Sales tax receivable. Sales tax is a tax imposed upon the sale or consumption of goods.
role.label: Sales Tax Receivable

role.documentation: That part of a scholarship or fellowship that is used to pay institutional charges such as tuition and fees or room and board charges. Scholarships and fellowships include Outright grants-in-aid, trainee stipends, tuition and fee waivers, and prizes awarded to students by the institution, including Pell grants. Awards to undergraduate students are most commonly referred to as "scholarships" and those to graduate students as "fellowships." These awards do not require the performance of services while a student (such as teaching) or subsequently as a result of the scholarship or fellowship. The term does not include loans to students (subject to repayment), College Work-Study Program (CWS), or awards granted to a parent of a student because of the parent's faculty or staff status. Also not included are awards to students where the selection of the student recipient is not made by the institution.
role.label: Scholarship Allowances

role.documentation: Securities lending collateral, assets.
role.label: Securities Lending Collateral, Assets

role.documentation: Securities lending obligations, liability.
role.label: Securities Lending Obligations, Liability

role.documentation: Current portion of accrued known and estimated losses incurred as of the balance sheet date for which no insurance coverage exists, and for which a claim has been made or is probable of being asserted, typically arising from workmen's compensation-type of incidents and personal injury to nonemployees from accidents on the entity's property.
role.label: Self Insurance Liabilities, Current Portion

role.documentation: Non-current portion of accrued known and estimated losses incurred as of the balance sheet date for which no insurance coverage exists, and for which a claim has been made or is probable of being asserted, typically arising from workmen's compensation-type of incidents and personal injury to nonemployees from accidents on the entity's property.
role.label: Self-insurance Liabilities, Net of Current Portion

role.documentation: Special and extraordinary items.
role.label: Special and Extraordinary Items

role.documentation: Special assessment taxes receivable, derived from state, municipal or school districts.
role.label: Special Assessment Taxes Receivable

role.documentation: State appropriations.
role.label: State Appropriations

role.documentation: State OPEB on-behalf contribution.
role.label: State OPEB Contribution

role.documentation: State retirement plan contributions.
role.label: State Retirement Plan Contributions

role.documentation: Contributions to pension or retirement plan for state university and community college (higher education) systems.
role.label: State University Retirement Contributions

role.documentation: Information about the Statement of Activities.
role.label: Statement of Activities [Abstract]

role.documentation: Information about the Statement of Activities, Expenses and Revenues for Programs and Functions, Component Unit.
role.label: Statement of Activities, Expenses and Revenues for Programs, Component Unit [Abstract]

role.documentation: Information about the Statement of Activities, General Revenues from Programs.
role.label: Statement of Activities, General Revenues[Abstract]

role.documentation: Information about the Statement of Activities, General Revenues from Programs, Component Unit.
role.label: Statement of Activities, General Revenues, Component Unit [Abstract]

role.documentation: Items that appear on the Statement of Activities.
role.label: Statement of Activities [Line Items]

role.label: Statement of Activities [Table]

role.documentation: Information about the Statement of Net Position.
role.label: Statement of Net Position [Abstract]

role.documentation: Information about the Statement of Net Position for Component Unit.
role.label: Statement of Net Position Component Unit [Abstract]

role.label: Statement of Net Position [Line Items]
